item.title: Glossary
item.description: AD - Active Directory - local database that contains all information. ADSI - Active Directory Service Interfaces AM - Access Management API - Application Programming Interface Attribute - specific criteria provided by the managed systems to describe the expected assignments for an identity. Bastion - element used like an intermediary so that an administrator connects to bastion when they need sensitive access. It allows action tracking. Claim - value for a given identity such as email, last name, groups, etc.

item.title: IGA and USERCUBE by Nicolas
item.description: IAM / IAG IGA -Identity Governance and Administration- is a combination of IAM and IAG. IAM -Identity Access Management- allows identities to have the right rights at the right time for the right reasons. IAG -Identity Access Governance- allows actors to follow the developments concerning identities and user access, and monitor compliance. Gartner is a form that means to give expert guidance and tools to enable smarter and faster decisions and stronger performance on an organization’s most critical priorities.

item.title: Introduction Guide
item.description: Overview Usercube is a three-aim solution for IGA. Aim 1 - Manage Identity Lifecycle Usercube builds a reliable directory of identities and manages their evolution. An identity can be an employee, contractor, partner, customer, object, software, robot. Aim 2 - Provide Entitlement Management Usercube creates an exhaustive and reliable catalog of the entitlements available in the managed systems and fulfills the right assignments to the right users.

item.title: Tutorial - Training steps
item.description: Installation of the USERCUBE Demo Latest Version In order to use USERCUBE on your local device, you need to realise an installation on premise. You follow the steps below: You first look for the latest version of the USERCUBE server on the Pipelines page. You download the three bottom folders : Runtime, SDK and SQL. On your computer C:\UsercubeDemo, you delete everything except Sources and Runtime folders.

item.title: Connectors
item.description: How to Create Connectors from the User Interface On the Home page of the USERCUBE server, there is a Connectors button. You click on this button and you see all existing connectors. To create a new one, you click on + New. You fill the information. In this example, we want to call our connector AD_TEST. We give the same name in English(US). We choose a local agent.
